Approximately 22 million White House e: mails exchanged via private servers during the G.W. Bush administration were deleted instead of being archived in accordance with the Presidential Records Act.
An undetermined number of the deleted e: mails were subsequently recovered, although they have not been released to the public.
The issue of: missing e-mails" became prominent during the 2016 presidential election due to Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton's mishandling of electronic communications while serving as secretary of state.
The deletion of approximately 30: 000 e-mails from Clinton's private server prior to an FBI investigation raised concerns about the potential mishandling of classified information.
